metadata.synopsis:
Takes place immediately after the player blows the horn at the gates of the grove, beginning an attack on the refugees hiding there. The surviving tiefling leader rallies his troops, then the drow commander arrives with her retinue of goblins. She mind-melds with the player. She expects them - as True Souls - to betray the tieflings, and players must choose whether to side with her OR with the tieflings as the attack begins.

This is a huge fight and a decisive moment for the tieflings, the drow/goblins, AND the players.

15.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Minthara steps up on the stone tower outside the gate to the Druid Grove, she assumes her imposing posture, arms at her back, she locks gaze with the player

57.speaker: Asharak
57.text: If I don't see you after the battle... tell the children I took out the drow.
57.context: NodeContext:  last phrase is delivered with a grim smile - if he doesn't see us, it's because he'll be dead

43.speaker: Zevlor
43.text: This is it. Everything turns on this.

44.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The archer nocks another arrow, when the army arrives beneath Minthara and lowers the bow to watch

45.speaker: Asharak
45.text: This is it, people. Weapons ready, eyes to the front.
45.context: NodeContext: Addressing the defenders gathered at the gates before an attack - inspirational speech. Think beginning of Helm's Deep

38.speaker: Asharak
38.text: Anyone who takes down a worg gets their choice of cut tonight...
38.context: NodeContext: Addressing the defenders gathered at the gates before an attack - inspirational speech. Think beginning of Helm's Deep

42.speaker: Asharak
42.text: By Amaunator's Eternal Sun, none of us are dying today!
42.context: NodeContext: Addressing the defenders gathered at the gates before an attack - inspirational speech. Think beginning of Helm's Deep

29.speaker: Zevlor
29.text: I know that you are all afraid... but I also know that you have been fighting your whole lives.
29.context: NodeContext: Addressing the defenders gathered at the gates before an attack - inspirational speech. Think beginning of Helm's Deep

10.speaker: Zevlor
10.text: We have never been handed the easy choices, or the gentle paths. And this is no different.
10.context: NodeContext: Addressing the defenders gathered at the gates before an attack - inspirational speech. Think beginning of Helm's Deep

26.speaker: Zevlor
26.text: These creatures would take our lives, our children... our future. And we must resist!
26.context: NodeContext: Addressing the defenders gathered at the gates before an attack - inspirational speech. Think beginning of Helm's Deep

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *A splinter of ice works its way into your mind.*

52.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
52.text: A pretty speech. It almost brings a tear to my eye.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Mindmeld [reuse]NodeContext: amused, referring to the tiefling leaders inspiring speech to the defenders but talking to the player

2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
2.text: Now slit his throat, and open that gate. The Absolute wants all of them dead.
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Mindmeld [reuse]NodeContext: simple, to the point - killing is a very ordinary thing to her

39.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player steps in an opens the gate [Reuse from Plea]

41.speaker: Wyll
41.text: Traitor! The Blade now comes for you.

34.speaker: Asharak
34.context: NodeContext: dawning horror - he's doomed and the players have betrayed him

0.speaker: Asharak
0.text: You're siding with that monster against your own people?
0.context: NodeContext: this is a horrible, terrible no-good realisation. He's taken aback by how bad things are right now. He's going to die

20.speaker: Asharak
20.context: NodeContext: furious; the players just betrayed him and are going to kill the people he swore to protect

62.speaker: Zevlor
62.context: NodeContext: despairing, the players have just betrayed him and doomed the people he swore to protect

31.speaker: Player
31.text: At least you'll die before the goblins find the children.

64.speaker: Asharak
64.context: NodeContext: furious, lots of venom on that 'monster'

49.speaker: Zevlor
49.context: NodeContext: can't believe how awful we are - we just told him we're going to massacre the children he's been protecting

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I'm truly sorry. I need healing - and the drow and her god are my best chance.

24.speaker: Asharak
24.context: NodeContext: furious, shocked - 'impspit' delivered as a strong swear

21.speaker: Zevlor
21.text: You're mad. How did I not see it?
21.context: NodeContext: He's realising that he just doomed his people by trusting us, but he blames himself. Quiet. Shocked.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Die in fear, afore a waking nightmare.

16.speaker: Zevlor
16.text: Gods forgive me... I've doomed them all.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: My people? I'm loyal only to myself.

50.speaker: Asharak
50.text: You'll burn in the Hells for this.

63.speaker: Zevlor
63.text: What are you doing? They'll kill us all...
63.context: NodeContext: shocked, genuinely doesn't understand what's happening - context: the player has opened gates allowing enemies to invade

58.speaker: Zevlor
58.text: ...Hells. You're siding with them, against your own people?
58.context: NodeContext: dawning realisation. We've betrayed him and he's going to die along with his people

54.speaker: Player
54.text: No. This grove is under my protection.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I serve Shar, not the Absolute. The gate stays closed.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Your god has no power here.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: New plan - I tear out your throat.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: There's been a change of plan.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: I will not. Boo will not. And if you think to triumph here today, drow - you will not.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Not so fast. You've just walked into my trap.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: These people are under my protection - but I'll see you in the Hells.

1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
1.text: Traitor! You think you can stand against me and the Absolute?

5.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~With a gesture Minthara orders the attack.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Of course - as does my god.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: No. I'll show the Absolute the power of a true god.

59.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
59.text: You cower behind a doomed god when the Absolute promised you such power?

17.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
17.text: You will die here. And your god will die with you.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: This place is sacred to Silvanus - the Absolute has no power here.

28.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
28.text: Sacred? It is filth. It will burn, and you will burn with it.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: They still think I'm on their side. Poor fools.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I will not bring death to this sacred place, Minthara.
